name: Fidelity MSCI Real Estate Index ETF
description: The Fidelity MSCI Real Estate Index ETF (FREL) is designed to provide investment results that correspond to the performance of the MSCI USA IMI Real Estate Index. This ETF seeks to provide exposure to the performance of the real estate sector, which includes real estate investment trusts (REITs) and other companies that own or operate income-producing real estate. Launched by Fidelity Investments, FREL aims to capture the growth potential of the real estate market while maintaining a diversified portfolio of holdings across various segments of the real estate industry. The fund employs a passive management strategy, tracking the index and providing investors with a low-cost option to gain exposure to real estate without the complexities of direct property ownership. With its focus on large, mid, and small-cap companies in the real estate sector, FREL is an attractive choice for investors looking to diversify their portfolios and add exposure to real estate, which can provide income through dividends and potential capital appreciation. As part of Fidelity’s suite of ETFs, FREL benefits from Fidelity’s expertise in asset management and commitment to providing quality investment products.

products: Fidelity MSCI Real Estate Index ETF (FREL)

faq.question: What does FREL invest in?
faq.answer: FREL invests in real estate investment trusts (REITs) and other companies that own or operate income-producing real estate.

faq.question: Who manages FREL?
faq.answer: FREL is managed by Fidelity Investments.

faq.question: What is the investment strategy of FREL?
faq.answer: FREL employs a passive management strategy, aiming to match the performance of the MSCI USA IMI Real Estate Index.
